{include "affiliate_loader"} Contact City Council in support of conversion therapy ban in Wheeling. {include "pre-header-spacing"}{beacon}

{include "default_salutation"} –

Tomorrow, the Wheeling City Council will vote on a conversion therapy ban for the city.

This would prevent licensed mental health practitioners, including religiously affiliated practitioners operating in a clinical setting, from engaging in the practice, which seeks to change a person's sexual orientation or gender identity. Conversion therapy is a widely discredited practice, having been debunked by every major medical association in the country. Studies show that LGBTQ+ people who are exposed to conversion therapy are a shocking 92% more likely to attempt suicide.

Contact the Wheeling City Council members before the Tuesday vote and tell them to ban this horrific practice.

  • 1st Ward Council Rep: Chad Thalman
    cthalman@wheelingwv.gov
  • 2nd Ward Council Rep: Ben Seidler
    bseidler@wheelingwv.gov
  • 3rd Ward Council Rep: Rosemary Ketchum
    rketchum@wheelingwv.gov
  • 4th Ward Council Rep: Jerry Sklavounakis
    jsklavounakis@wheelingwv.gov
  • 5th Ward Council Rep: Ty Thorngate
    tthorngate@wheelingwv.gov
  • 6th Ward Council Rep: Dave Palmer
    dpalmer@wheelingwv.gov

Let's make Wheeling the third city in West Virginia to ban conversion therapy.

In Solidarity,
